sen.j: 三条西 実条（さんじょうにし さねえだ、天正3年1月26日 (旧暦)（1575年3月8日） - 寛永17年10月9日 (旧暦)（1640年11月22日））は、安土桃山時代から江戸時代初期にかけて活躍した公家。
sen.e: Saneki SANJONISHI (March 8, 1575 - November 22, 1640) was a noble who actively worked in the period from Azuchi-Momoyama Period to the beginning of Edo Period.
Saneki SANJONISHI (March 8, 1575 - November 22, 1640) was a noble who was active from the Azuchi-Momoyama Period to the beginning of Edo Period.
Saneeda SANJONISHI (March 8, 1575 - November 22, 1640) was a noble who was active from the Azuchi-Momoyama Period to the beginning of Edo Period.

sen.j: 号は香雲院。
sen.e: His Pseudonym was Kounin.
He was also known as Kounin.
He was also known as Kounin.

sen.j: 三条西家（家格は大臣家）当主。
sen.e: He was the family head of the Sanjonishi family (with social standing of daijinke (house of minister)).
He was the family head of the Sanjonishi family (with a social rank of daijinke – or minister's household).
He was the family head of the Sanjonishi family (with a social rank of daijinke – or minister's household).

sen.j: 父は内大臣・三条西公国。
sen.e: His father was Kinkuni SANJONISHI, who was Naidaijin (the Minister of the Interior).
His father was Kinkuni SANJONISHI, who was Naidaijin (the Minister of the Interior).
His father was Kinkuni SANJONISHI, who was Naidaijin (the Minister of the Interior).

sen.j: 祖父は三条西実枝。
sen.e: His grandfather was Saneki SANJONISHI.
His grandfather was Saneki SANJONISHI.
His grandfather was Saneki SANJONISHI.

sen.j: 弟に三条西公広がいる。
sen.e: Kinhiro SANJONISHI was his younger brother.
Kinhiro SANJONISHI was his younger brother.
Kinhiro SANJONISHI was his younger brother.

sen.j: 略歴
sen.e: Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History

sen.j: 天正3年（1575年）三条西公国の長男として誕生。
sen.e: He was born in 1575 as the first son of Kinkuni SANJONISHI.
He was born in 1575 as the first son of Kinkuni SANJONISHI.
He was born in 1575 as the first son of Kinkuni SANJONISHI.

sen.j: 翌年、叙爵。
sen.e: Next year, he was ennobled.
Next year, he was ennobled.
Next year, he was ennobled.

sen.j: 侍従に任ぜられる。
sen.e: He was appointed as Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff).
He was appointed Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff).
He was appointed Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff).

sen.j: 慶長2年（1597年）参議となり、公卿に列する。
sen.e: In 1597, he became Sangi (councillor) and ranked among nobles.
In 1597, he became Sangi (councillor) and ranked among nobles.
In 1597, he became Sangi (councillor) and ranked among nobles.

sen.j: 翌年従三位。
sen.e: Next year, he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
Next year, he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
Next year, he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).

sen.j: 江戸幕府が開幕すると、武家（幕府）からの奏請を朝廷へ取り次ぐ折衝役として室町時代と同様、武家伝奏の職が設けられた。
sen.e: As Edo bakufu (Edo shogunate) was opened, posts of buke tenso, which were liaison officers who communicate requests from the military government (shogunate) to the imperial court, were established same as in the Muromachi Period.

With the beginning of the Edo bakufu (Edo shogunate), the posts of buke tenso (liaison officers who communicate requests from the military government to the imperial court) were established just as in the Muromachi Period.

With the beginning of the Edo bakufu (Edo shogunate), the posts of buke tenso (liaison officers who communicate requests from the military government to the imperial court) were established just as in the Muromachi Period.

sen.j: 実条は慶長18年7月11日 (旧暦)（1613年8月26日）武家伝奏に任ぜられ、幕府との交渉を担うこととなった。
sen.e: On August 26, 1613, Saneki was appointed as a buke tenso and became in charge of negotiations with the shogunate.
On August 26, 1613, Saneki was appointed buke tenso and was put in charge of negotiations with the shogunate.
On August 26, 1613, Saneeda was appointed buke tenso and was put in charge of negotiations with the shogunate.

sen.j: 元和 (日本)9年（1623年）には、幕府3代征夷大将軍・徳川家光の将軍宣下に際して上卿（口頭で天皇からの宣旨を伝える役）を務めた。
sen.e: In 1623, on the occasion of appointment to Shogun of the third seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of the bakufu, Iemitsu TOKUGAWA, he played a role of shokei (post to verbally convey an informal Imperial letter senji of the emperor).
sen.cmt: letterをverballyに伝えることはあり得ませんが、原文に従いました。
sen.e: In 1623, on the occasion of the appointment of the third Seii Taishogun of the bakufu, Iemitsu TOKUGAWA, he played the role of shokei (one who verbally conveys an informal message from the Emperor).
In 1623, on the occasion of the appointment of the third Seii Taishogun of the bakufu, Iemitsu TOKUGAWA, he played the role of shokei (one who verbally conveys an informal message from the Emperor).

sen.j: なお家光の乳母・春日局（斎藤福）は、父斎藤利三が主君明智光秀の起こした本能寺の変に従い、山崎の戦いに敗死した後、母方の親戚である三条西公国に引き取られ三条西邸で養育された過去があり、実条とも幼少より親交が深かった。
sen.e: Kasuga no Tsubone (Fuku SAITO), who was the wet nurse of Iemitsu, was on friendly terms with Saneki since their early childhood, because, after her father, Toshimitsu SAITO followed the army in the Honnoji Incident, which was initiated by his master, Mitsuhide AKECHI, and died in the battle of Yamazaki, she was took on by Kinkuni SANJONISHI, who was her maternal relative and brought up in the mansion in Sanjonishi.

Kasuga no Tsubone (Fuku SAITO), who was Iemitsu's wet nurse, was on friendly terms with Saneki from their early childhood, because, after her father, Toshimitsu SAITO went with the army in the Honnoji Incident, which was initiated by his master, Mitsuhide AKECHI, and died in the battle of Yamazaki, she was taken in by Kinkuni SANJONISHI, who was a relative on her mother's side, and grew up in the mansion at Sanjonishi.
sen.cmt: reworded for clarity, but this is still a really confusing, run-on sentence
sen.e: Kasuga no Tsubone (Fuku SAITO), who was Iemitsu's wet nurse, was on friendly terms with Saneeda from their early childhood, because, after her father, Toshimitsu SAITO went with the army in the Honnoji Incident, which was initiated by his master, Mitsuhide AKECHI, and died in the battle of Yamazaki, she was taken in by Kinkuni SANJONISHI, who was a relative on her mother's side, and grew up in the mansion at Sanjonishi.

sen.j: 寛永6年（1629年）春日局が病中の家光の代理として上洛した際、御所へ昇殿する資格がなかった。
sen.e: In 1629, when Kasuga no Tsubone visited Kyoto as a representative of Iemitsu, who was ill, she had no qualification to access to the imperial court.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処置
sen.e: In 1629, when Kasuga no Tsubone visited Kyoto as a representative of Iemitsu, who was ill, she had no credentials to access to the imperial court.
In 1629, when Kasuga no Tsubone visited Kyoto as a representative of Iemitsu, who was ill, she had no credentials to access to the imperial court.

sen.j: 同年内大臣となった実条の義理の妹（猶妹）として縁組を行い、三条西家の女性の資格で参内し、後水尾天皇に拝謁を許されることとなった。
sen.e: An arrangement of adoption was made to make her a sister-in-law (adopted sister) of Saneki, who had become naidaijin (minister of center) in the same year, and she entered the imperial court with the qualification as a lady from the Nishisanjo family and allowed to meet the Emperor Gomizunoo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処置
sen.e: An arrangement of adoption was made to make her a sister-in-law of Saneki, who had become naidaijin (minister of the interior) that same year, and she entered the imperial court as a lady from the Nishisanjo family and was allowed to meet the Emperor Gomizunoo.

An arrangement of adoption was made to make her a sister-in-law of Saneeda, who had become naidaijin (minister of the interior) that same year, and she entered the imperial court as a lady from the Sanjonishi family and was allowed to meet the Emperor Gomizunoo.

sen.j: しかしこの強引な手法に、かねてから紫衣事件などで幕府の圧迫に不快を感じていた後水尾天皇は、二女の興子内親王（明正天皇）に譲位する事態となる。
sen.e: With respect to this aggressive method, the Emperor Gomizunoo, who had long-felt strong unpleasantness against pressure from bakufu because of the Shie Incident and so on, abdicated the throne in favor of his second daughter, Imperial Princess Okiko (Emperor Meisho)..

In response this aggressive posturing, Emperor Gomizunoo, upset by pressure from the bakufu surrounding the Shie Incident, abdicated the throne in favor of his second daughter, Imperial Princess Okiko (Emperor Meisho).

In response this aggressive posturing, Emperor Gomizunoo, upset by pressure from the bakufu surrounding the Shie Incident, abdicated the throne in favor of his second daughter, Imperial Princess Okiko (Emperor Meisho).

sen.j: この武家と朝廷の確執に際し、実条は終始幕府側の意向に忠実に従い、同役（武家伝奏）の中院通村が後水尾帝の意に沿って行動したのと対照的であった（通村は翌年罷免された）。
sen.e: On the occasion of this discord between buke (samurai) and the imperial court, Saneki consistently followed intention of bakufu in contract to Michimura NAKANOIN, who was also bukedenso and acted in accordance with intention of the Emperor Gomizunoo (Michimura was dismissed next year).

Seeing such discord between samurai and the imperial court, Saneki consistently obeyed the bakufu and the will of Michimura NAKANOIN, who was also bukedenso and acted in accordance with intention of the Emperor Gomizunoo (Michimura was dismissed next year).
sen.cmt: I made the sentence flow better, but it still won't make much sense to someone not familiar with the terms
sen.e: Seeing such discord between samurai and the imperial court, Saneeda faithfully obeyed the commands of the bakufu; this was in contrast to Michimura NAKANOIN, who like Saneeda held the position of bukedenso (liaison officers between the imperial court and the military government), but acted in accordance with the intentions of Emperor Gomizunoo (Michimura was dismissed the following year).
sen.cmt: 「対照的に」なので、in contrast toにしました。

sen.j: 寛永12年（1635年）従一位に進み、同17年（1640年）6月には徳川家光の執奏により、三条西家としては異例の右大臣に任ぜられる。
sen.e: In 1635, he was promoted to Juichi (Junior First Rank) and, in June 1640, through reporting by Iemitsu, he was appointed to udaijin (minister of the right) that was quite exceptional the Sanjonishi family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処置
sen.e: In 1635, he was promoted to Juichii (Junior First Rank) and, in June 1640, through reporting by Iemitsu, he was appointed to udaijin (minister of the right) that was quite exceptional the Sanjonishi family.

In 1635, he was promoted to Juichii (Junior First Rank) and, in June 1640, through reporting by Iemitsu, he was appointed to udaijin (minister of the right) that was quite exceptional for the Sanjonishi family.

sen.j: （大臣家の極官は内大臣が通例であり、右大臣任官は近世では実条と中院通躬のみ）。
sen.e: (The kyokkan (the highest rank which one may be appointed) for Daijinke (house of minister) was usually Naidaijin and, in early modern time, only Saneki and Michimi NAKANOIN were appointed to udaijin.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処置
sen.e: (The kyokkan - the highest rank - for a Daijinke, or ministerial household, was usually Naidaijin and in early modern times only Saneki and Michimi NAKANOIN were appointed to udaijin.)
(The kyokkan - the highest rank - for a Daijinke, or ministerial household, was usually Naidaijin and in early modern times only Saneeda and Michimi NAKANOIN were appointed to udaijin.)

sen.j: しかし、3ヶ月後の10月には辞退。
sen.e: However, he excused himself from the position of udaijin three months later, in October.
However, he excused himself from the position of udaijin three months later, in October.
However, he excused himself from the position of udaijin three months later, in October.

sen.j: 同月、武家伝奏の任のまま死去した。
sen.e: In the same month, he died while he remained in the position of buke tenso.
In the same month, he died while still in the position of buke tenso.
In the same month, he died while still in the position of buke tenso.

sen.j: 子に三条西公勝、武者小路公種、西郊実号などがいる。
sen.e: He had children including Kimikatsu SANJO, Kimitane MUSHANOKOJI and Saiko Jitugo [西郊実号 読み不明]
His children included Kimikatsu SANJO, Kimitane MUSHANOKOJI and Saiko Jitugo.
sen.cmt: comments belong in the comment column
sen.e: His children included Kimikatsu SANJO, Kimitane MUSHANOKOJI and Saiko Jitugo.

sen.j: 歌道
sen.e: Waka poetry
Waka poetry
Waka poetry

sen.j: 三条西家の家職は和歌であり、戦国時代 (日本)前期の当主・三条西実隆は当代随一の歌人と評された（実条の高祖父にあたる）。
sen.e: The family business of the Sanjonishi family was waka poem and the family head in the beginning of the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States), Sanetaka SANJONISHI, was commented as the best existing waka poet. (He was the grandfather of Saneki.)

The family business of the Sanjonishi family was waka poetry, and the family head in the beginning of the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States), Sanetaka SANJONISHI (grandfather of Saneki), was considered the best existing waka poet.

The family business of the Sanjonishi family was waka poetry, and the family head in the beginning of the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States), Sanetaka SANJONISHI (grandfather of Saneeda), was considered the best existing waka poet.

sen.j: 実隆・三条西公条・三条西実枝の三代はいずれも歌道に優れており、家職として歌道を継承した（古今伝授）。
sen.e: Three successive generations, Sanetaka, Kineda SANJONISHI and Saneki SANJONISHI, were good at waka poetry and succeeded waka poetry as family business. (Kokin denju (the secret transmissions of the "Kokinshu," Anthology of Old and New Japanese Poems))

Three successive generations, Sanetaka, Kineda SANJONISHI and Saneki SANJONISHI, were good at waka poetry and kept up the family business. (Kokin denju - the secret transmissions of the "Kokinshu," Anthology of Old and New Japanese Poems)

Three successive generations, Sanetaka, Kineda SANJONISHI and Saneki SANJONISHI, were good at waka poetry and kept up the family business. (Kokin denju - the secret transmissions of the "Kokinshu," Anthology of Old and New Japanese Poems)

sen.j: しかし実枝は子の公国が幼かったため、弟子の一人であった細川幽斎に中継ぎとして歌道を継承した。
sen.e: However, in the case of Saneki, his son, Kinkuni, was too young, waka poetry was transmitted to Yusai HOSOKAWA, who was Saneki's pupil as an intermediary.
However, because Saneki's son, Kinkuni, was too young, the waka poetry tradition was carried on by Yusai HOSOKAWA, who was Saneki's pupil.
However, because Saneeda's son, Kinkuni, was too young, the waka poetry tradition was carried on by Yusai HOSOKAWA, who was Saneeda's pupil.

sen.j: 公国成人後、幽斎は歌道を継承しようとしたが、公国は夭折した。
sen.e: After Kinkuni grew up, Yusai tried to transmit waka poetry to him, but Kinkuni died young.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処置
sen.e: After Kinkuni grew up, Yusai tried to turn it over to him, but Kinkuni died young.
After Kinkuni grew up, Yusai tried to turn it over to him, but Kinkuni died young.

sen.j: 幽斎は改めて公国の子である実条に歌学伝授を行い、師・実枝との約束を果たした。
sen.e: Yusai renewedly transmitted waka poetry to Kinkuni's son, Saneki, to keep his promise with his teacher, Saneki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処置
sen.e: Yusai once again passed the tradition on to Kinkuni's son, Saneki, to keep his promise to his teacher.
Yusai once again passed the tradition on to Kinkuni's son, Saneeda, to keep his promise to his teacher.

sen.j: 官職位階履歴
sen.e: History of official position and rank
History of official position and rank
History of official position and rank
